All observational datasets indicate that the volumetric distribution shifts toward lower salinities, i.e. on average, fresh regions become fresher at a higher rate than saline regions become more saline (see Fig. 2 and supplementary Fig. 1). This suggests a global net freshwater input. Considering the change in global mean salinity, the apparent net freshwater input is F
melt = 0.029 Sv for En4, 0.025 Sv for Ishii, and 0.044 Sv for CSIRO.
